page.title: 17Manor House,Wall Camp/Farm
page.content: Kynnersley Manor House,which was largely rebuilt in the Duke of Sutherland style in 1860 has a panneled room that used to be the local court room.Until 1840 villagers were tried in this room and if convicted of such crimes as sheep stealing were hanged from the Oak tree on the Whym,which is a triangular piece of raised ground just outside the Manor House.It is thought that the bodies were then buried in a piece of ground at the side of Whym cottage,the ground is now incorporated into Whym cottages garden.A most interesting ancient site is the remains of extensive earthworks enclosing over 20 acres and surrounding the buildings of Wall Farm.The embankment is of stones and earth and about 20 feet wide.
